alert.note: Alert for Osage (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 9:46PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Osage and northwestern Pawnee Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 946 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles west of Elgin to 2 miles east of Burbank to 3 miles northeast of Marland. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fairfax... Shidler... Burbank... Elgin... Foraker... Bigheart... Pearsonia... Sooner Lake... Southwestern Kaw Lake... Webb City... Apperson... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
